104//*****************************************************************************
105//
116//
117//*****************************************************************************
118typedef enum
119{
120 AM_HAL_USB_CHARGER_DATA_PIN_CONNECTED,
121 AM_HAL_USB_CHARGER_DATA_PIN_CONNECTION_UNKNOWN,
122}
123am_hal_usb_charger_data_pin_status_e;
125
126//*****************************************************************************
127//
139//
140//*****************************************************************************
141typedef enum
142{
143 AM_HAL_USB_CHARGER_SDP,
144 AM_HAL_USB_CHARGER_CDP,
145 AM_HAL_USB_CHARGER_DCP,
146 AM_HAL_USB_CHARGER_NO_CHARGER
147} am_hal_usb_charger_type_e;
149
150//*****************************************************************************
151//
159//
160//*****************************************************************************
161typedef enum
162{
163 AM_HAL_USB_CHARGER_SET_REF_VOL_TO_1P65 = 0x0, // set comparator voltage to 1.65V
164 AM_HAL_USB_CHARGER_SET_REF_VOL_TO_3P10V = 0x1, // set comparator voltage to 3.10V
165 AM_HAL_USB_CHARGER_SET_REF_VOL_TO_2P35 = 0x2, // set comparator voltage to 2.35V
166 AM_HAL_USB_CHARGER_SET_REF_VOL_TO_1P25V = 0x3 // set comparator voltage to 1.25V
167} am_hal_usb_charger_comparator_reference_voltage_e;
169
170
171//*****************************************************************************
172//
176//
177//*****************************************************************************
178static inline void am_hal_usb_hardware_unreset(void)
179{
180 //
181 // Unreset the USB controller and PHY. To make sure the USB can do enumuration, all the USB charger detection
182 // circuit should be disconnected from the Dp/Dm pins.
183 //
184 USB->BCDETCRTL1 =
185 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_USBSWRESET, 1) |
186 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_USBDCOMPEN, 0) |
187 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_USBDCOMPREF, 0) |
188 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_IDPSINKEN, 0) |
189 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_VDMSRCEN, 0) |
190 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_RDMPDWNEN, 0) |
191 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_VDPSRCEN, 0) |
192 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_IDPSRCEN, 0) |
193 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_IDMSINKEN, 0) |
194 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_BCWEAKPULLDOWNEN, 0) |
195 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_BCWEAKPULLUPEN, 0);
196}
197
198//*****************************************************************
199//
203//
204//*****************************************************************
205
206static inline void am_hal_usb_hardware_reset(void)
207{
208 //
209 // Holds a USB controller and PHY in the reset for BC detection
210 // After MCU hardware reset, the USB is always in reset.
211 //
212 USB->BCDETCRTL1_b.USBSWRESET = 0;
213}
214
215//*****************************************************************************
216//
220//
221//*****************************************************************************
222
223static inline void am_hal_usb_charger_enable_data_pin_contact_detection(void)
224{
225 //
226 // Clear all other bits
227 // Holds a USB controller and PHY in the reset for BC detection
228 // enables DP current source as per USB BC 1.2 spec.
229 // enables DM pull-down as per USB BC 1.2 spec.
230 //
231 USB->BCDETCRTL1 =
232 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_USBSWRESET, 0) |
233 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_IDPSRCEN, 1) |
234 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_RDMPDWNEN, 1);
235}
236
237//*****************************************************************************
238//
242//
243//*****************************************************************************
244static inline am_hal_usb_charger_data_pin_status_e am_hal_usb_charger_data_pin_connection_status(void)
245{
246 return ( USB->BCDETSTATUS_b.DPATTACHED )? AM_HAL_USB_CHARGER_DATA_PIN_CONNECTED :AM_HAL_USB_CHARGER_DATA_PIN_CONNECTION_UNKNOWN;
247}
248
249//*****************************************************************************
250//
254//
255//*****************************************************************************
256static inline void am_hal_usb_charger_enable_primary_detection(void)
257{
258 //
259 // Clear all other bits
260 // Holds a USB controller and PHY in the reset for BC detection
261 // enables DM current sink as per USB BC 1.2 spec.
262 // enables DP voltage source as per USB BC 1.2 spec.
263 //
264 USB->BCDETCRTL1 =
265 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_USBSWRESET, 0) |
266 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_IDMSINKEN, 1) |
267 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_VDPSRCEN, 1);
268}
269
270//*****************************************************************************
271//
272
281//
282//*****************************************************************************
283static inline am_hal_usb_charger_type_e am_hal_usb_charger_sdp_connection_status(void)
284{
285 //
286 // During Primary Detection the PD shall turn on VDP_SRC and IDM_SINK. When a voltage of VDP_SRC is
287 // applied to Dp, an SDP will continue pulling Dm low through RDM_DWN.
288 // A PD shall compare the voltage on Dm with VDAT_REF. If Dm is less than VDAT_REF, then the PD is
289 // allowed determining that it is attached to an SDP. Because the Dm is less than VDAT_REF, the
290 // CPDETECTED would be zero.
291 //
292 return (USB->BCDETSTATUS_b.CPDETECTED == 0) ? AM_HAL_USB_CHARGER_SDP: AM_HAL_USB_CHARGER_NO_CHARGER;
293}
294
295//*****************************************************************************
296//
304//
305//*****************************************************************************
306static inline void am_hal_usb_charger_enable_secondary_detection(void)
307{
308 //
309 // Secondary Detection can be used to distinguish between a DCP and a CDP. PDs that are not ready
310 // to be enumerated within TSVLD_CON_PWD of detecting VBUS are required to implement Secondary
311 // Detection. PDs that are ready to be enumerated are allowed to bypass Secondary Detection.
312 // During Secondary Detection, a PD shall output VDM_SRC(0.5V) on Dm, turn on IDP_SINK, and compare the
313 // voltage on Dp to VDAT_REF(0.25V). Since a DCP is required to short Dp to Dm through a resistance
314 // of RDCP_DAT(200 ohm), the voltage on Dp will be close to VDM_SRC, which is above VDAT_REF.
315 // If a PD detects that Dp is greater than VDAT_REF, it knows that it is attached to a DCP.
316 //
317 USB->BCDETCRTL1 =
318 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_USBSWRESET, 0) |
319 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_VDMSRCEN, 1) |
320 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_IDPSINKEN, 1);
321}
322
323//*****************************************************************************
324//
331//
332//*****************************************************************************
333static inline void am_hal_usb_charger_enable_cdp_charger(void)
334{
335 //
336 // If a PD detects that Dp is less than VDAT_REF, it knows that it is attached to a CDP.
337 // It is then required to turn off VDP_SRC and VDM_SRC, as shown in the Good Battery
338 // Algorithm in Section 3.3.2, and is allowed to draw IDEV_CHG.
339 // Note: Here all bits in BCDETCRTL1 are cleared to zero.
340 //
341 USB->BCDETCRTL1 =
342 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_USBSWRESET, 0) |
343 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_VDMSRCEN, 0) |
344 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_VDPSRCEN, 0);
345}
346
347//*****************************************************************************
348//
355//
356//*****************************************************************************
357static inline void am_hal_usb_charger_enable_dcp_charger(void)
358{
359 //
360 // If a PD detects that Dp is greater than VDAT_REF, it knows that it is attached to a DCP.
361 // It is then required to enable VDP_SRC or pull Dp to VDP_UP through RDP_UP, as defined in
362 // the Good Battery Algorithm in Section 3.3.2.
363 //
364 USB->BCDETCRTL1 =
365 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_USBSWRESET, 0) |
366 _VAL2FLD(USB_BCDETCRTL1_VDPSRCEN, 1);
367}
368
369//*****************************************************************************
370//
379//
380//*****************************************************************************
381static inline am_hal_usb_charger_type_e am_hal_usb_charger_cdp_or_dcp_connection_status(void)
382{
383 return ( USB->BCDETSTATUS_b.DCPDETECTED ) ? AM_HAL_USB_CHARGER_DCP : AM_HAL_USB_CHARGER_CDP;
384}
385
386//*****************************************************************************
387//
397//
398//*****************************************************************************
399static inline void am_hal_usb_charger_configure_vendore_comparators(am_hal_usb_charger_comparator_reference_voltage_e e)
400{
401 //
402 // Make sure the USB logic held in reset
403 //
404 USB->BCDETCRTL1_b.USBSWRESET = 0;
405
406 //
407 // Enable the DM/DP comparators
408 //
409 USB->BCDETCRTL1_b.USBDCOMPEN = 1;
410 USB->BCDETCRTL1_b.USBDCOMPREF = (unsigned) e;
411}
412
413//*****************************************************************************
414//
418//
419//*****************************************************************************
420static inline void am_hal_usb_charger_disable_vendore_comparators(void)
421{
422 //
423 // Disable the DM/DP comparators
424 //
425 USB->BCDETCRTL1_b.USBDCOMPEN = 0;
426}
427
428//*****************************************************************************
429//
433//
434//*****************************************************************************
435static inline uint32_t am_hal_usb_charger_read_dp_comparator_output(void)
436{
437 return USB->BCDETSTATUS_b.DPCOMPOUT;
438}
439
440//*****************************************************************************
441//
445//
446//*****************************************************************************
447static inline uint32_t am_hal_usb_charger_read_dm_comparator_output(void)
448{
449 return USB->BCDETSTATUS_b.DMCOMPOUT;
450}
451
452//*****************************************************************************
453//
457//
458//*****************************************************************************
459static inline void am_hal_usb_enable_phy_reset_override(void)
460{
461 MCUCTRL->USBRSTCTRL &= ~ (_VAL2FLD(MCUCTRL_USBRSTCTRL_USBRSTENABLE, 0x1) |
462 _VAL2FLD(MCUCTRL_USBRSTCTRL_USBPORRSTRELEASE, 0x1) |
463 _VAL2FLD(MCUCTRL_USBRSTCTRL_USBUTMIRSTRELEASE, 0x1));
464}
465
466//*****************************************************************************
467//
471//
472//*****************************************************************************
473static inline void am_hal_usb_disable_phy_reset_override(void)
474{
475 MCUCTRL->USBRSTCTRL |= (_VAL2FLD(MCUCTRL_USBRSTCTRL_USBRSTENABLE, 0x1) |
476 _VAL2FLD(MCUCTRL_USBRSTCTRL_USBPORRSTRELEASE, 0x1) |
477 _VAL2FLD(MCUCTRL_USBRSTCTRL_USBUTMIRSTRELEASE, 0x1));
478}
